segment.source: Set up a device for anyone to use (kiosk mode) (Windows 10)
segment.target: Set up a device for anyone to use (kiosk mode) (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can configure Windows 10 as a kiosk device, so that users can only interact with a single app.
segment.target: You can configure Windows 10 as a kiosk device, so that users can only interact with a single app.

segment.source: Set up a device for anyone to use (kiosk mode)
segment.target: Set up a device for anyone to use (kiosk mode)

segment.source: Looking for Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry information?
segment.target: Looking for Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry information?

segment.source: You can configure a device running Windows 10 Pro, Windows 10 Enterprise, Windows 10 Education, Windows 10 Mobile, or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise as a kiosk device, so that users can only interact with a single application that you select.
segment.target: You can configure a device running Windows 10 Pro, Windows 10 Enterprise, Windows 10 Education, Windows 10 Mobile, or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise as a kiosk device, so that users can only interact with a single application that you select.

segment.source: Do you need a computer that can only do one thing?
segment.target: Do you need a computer that can only do one thing?

segment.source: A device in the lobby that customers can use to view your product catalog.
segment.target: A device in the lobby that customers can use to view your product catalog.

segment.source: A portable device that drivers can use to check a route on a map.
segment.target: A portable device that drivers can use to check a route on a map.

segment.source: A device that a temporary worker uses to enter data.
segment.target: A device that a temporary worker uses to enter data.

segment.source: The following table identifies the type of application that can be used on each Windows 10 edition to create a kiosk device.
segment.target: The following table identifies the type of application that can be used on each Windows 10 edition to create a kiosk device.

segment.source: A Universal Windows app is built on the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), which was first introduced in Windows 8 as the Windows Runtime.
segment.target: A Universal Windows app is built on the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), which was first introduced in Windows 8 as the Windows Runtime.

segment.source: A Classic Windows application uses the Classic Windows Platform (CWP) (e.g., COM, Win32, WPF, WinForms, etc.) and is typically launched using an .EXE or .DLL file.
segment.target: A Classic Windows application uses the Classic Windows Platform (CWP) (e.g., COM, Win32, WPF, WinForms, etc.) and is typically launched using an .EXE or .DLL file.

segment.source: Set up a kiosk on Windows 10 Pro, Enterprise, or Education
segment.target: Set up a kiosk on Windows 10 Pro, Enterprise, or Education

segment.source: A single-use device is easy to set up in Windows 10 for desktop editions (Pro, Enterprise, and Education).
segment.target: A single-use device is easy to set up in Windows 10 for desktop editions (Pro, Enterprise, and Education).

segment.source: For a kiosk device to run a Universal Windows app, use the assigned access feature.
segment.target: For a kiosk device to run a Universal Windows app, use the assigned access feature.

segment.source: For a kiosk device (Windows 10 Enterprise or Education) to run a Classic Windows application, use Shell Launcher to set a custom user interface as the shell.
segment.target: For a kiosk device (Windows 10 Enterprise or Education) to run a Classic Windows application, use Shell Launcher to set a custom user interface as the shell.

segment.source: Set up a kiosk on Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise
segment.target: Set up a kiosk on Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise

segment.source: A device in kiosk mode runs a specified app with no access to other device functions, menus, or settings.
segment.target: A device in kiosk mode runs a specified app with no access to other device functions, menus, or settings.

segment.source: You configure a device running Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise for kiosk mode by using the Apps Corner feature.
segment.target: You configure a device running Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise for kiosk mode by using the Apps Corner feature.

segment.source: You can also use the Enterprise Assigned Access configuration service provider (CSP) to configure a kiosk experience.
segment.target: You can also use the Enterprise Assigned Access configuration service provider (CSP) to configure a kiosk experience.

segment.source: Customizing Your Device Experience with Assigned Access
segment.target: Customizing Your Device Experience with Assigned Access
